source_caption_data.pre_caption: Two square photographs are presented side-by-side on a dark gray, speckled wall. The photograph on the left is in black and white, showing a cluster of old, wooden, two-story houses with pitched roofs lining the edge of a body of water. The buildings and the trees behind them are reflected in the calm water. The photograph on the right is in color and depicts a modern, multi-story apartment building with a light-colored facade and numerous balconies, also situated next to water, with its reflection visible on the surface. Above the two photographs, a horizontal, twisted, teal-colored bar is mounted to the wall.
source_caption_data.pre_caption_prompt:
Provide a concise yet informative description of the subjects in this video. Keep the description concise and clear, focusing on subject types and visual attributes. You should describe the video by combining details from the frames without referring to any specific one (e.g., don’t mention things like "first frame" or "last frame"), and avoid using terms like "image" or "frame." Don't mention the background or motion unless it's necessary to distinguish subjects by location, action, or relationships. You must avoid describing what is not visible or what you are unsure about. You must use simple, natural English and ensure the description is a clear, concise, and coherent paragraph that highlights the most essential details. You must avoid subjective adjectives that convey emotions. Whenever you mention a subject, please describe its key visual attributes in detail. Return only the one-paragraph video description without Markdown formatting or introductory text.

Clearly identify each subject’s type, using precise terms such as “man,” “woman,” “dog,” “car,” or “tree,” rather than vague words like “thing” or “item.” If the subject type is ambiguous, use your best judgment and briefly explain your reasoning.

Describe key visual attributes with specific and descriptive language. For people, include details such as clothing color and style, skin tone, hairstyle, facial hair, age (if discernible), gender, ethnicity (if relevant and clear), and facial expression. For objects, describe their color, material, shape, and distinguishing features like texture or markings. Additionally, note the subject’s pose and orientation within the frame, such as standing, sitting, walking, or facing a certain direction. Pay attention to any objects that are not in their usual state, like a tilted lamp or an open book lying face down.

If there are multiple subjects to describe, ensure clarity in referring to each. The simplest way is by type, such as “the man,” “the dog,” or “the tree.” If multiple subjects belong to the same category, distinguish them using unique appearance traits (e.g., “the woman in the red dress,” “the man with the beard”), location within the scene (e.g., “the man on the left,” “the car in the midground”), actions (e.g., “the child playing with a ball,” “the bird flying”), or relationships to each other (e.g., “the man next to the woman,” “the first man that enters the frame”). Also, when describing multiple subjects, the order in which they are mentioned matters. Prioritize based on relevance, starting with the largest or most centered subject. If the scene unfolds over time, describe subjects in the order they appear. If temporal order isn’t relevant, begin with the most visually striking or important subject before moving to less prominent ones. The goal is to provide enough detail so that anyone reading the description can easily identify each subject.

Please note that the video features salient **non-human** subjects, so the description should focus on them.

Please avoid using phrases like "the first frame" or "the last frame" in your description. Instead, refer to the entire sequence simply as "the video." Your description should integrate observations from all frames into a cohesive, temporally and logically consistent narrative, rather than describing frames in isolation. Whenever you mention a subject, be sure to include detailed descriptions of its key visual attributes. The final output should be a single, fluent paragraph describing the video, with no Markdown formatting or introductory text. Don't mention the surroundings or the subject's motion unless necessary to distinguish subjects by location, action, or relationship.
source_caption_data.initial_feedback:
In addition to the two-story houses with pitched roofs, there are also single-story houses. Behind them, taller houses with pitched roofs are visible.

Most of the buildings and trees on the ground are reflected in the calm water, not just the buildings and the trees behind them.

The photograph on the right shows several multi-story apartment bulidings, not just one

A horizontal, twisted, teal-colored rope, not a bar, is pinned to the wall. Its ends are bent into vertical short lines pointing downward.
source_caption_data.gpt_feedback:
In addition to the two-story houses with pitched roofs, there are also single-story houses visible. Behind them, taller houses with pitched roofs can be seen.

Most of the buildings and trees on the ground are reflected in the calm water, not just the buildings and trees behind them.

The photograph on the right depicts several multi-story apartment buildings, not just one.

A horizontal, twisted, teal-colored rope, rather than a bar, is affixed to the wall. Its ends are bent into short vertical lines pointing downward.

In addition to the two-story houses with pitched roofs, there are also single-story houses visible. Behind them, taller houses with pitched roofs can be seen.

Most of the buildings and trees on the ground are reflected in the calm water, not just the buildings and trees behind them.

The photograph on the right depicts several multi-story apartment buildings, not just one.

A horizontal, twisted, teal-colored rope, rather than a bar, is affixed to the wall. Its ends are bent into short vertical lines pointing downward.
source_caption_data.gpt_caption: Two square photographs are presented side-by-side on a dark gray, speckled wall. The photograph on the left is in black and white, showing a cluster of old, wooden houses, including both single-story and two-story structures with pitched roofs, lining the edge of a body of water. Behind them, taller houses with pitched roofs can be seen. Most of the buildings and trees on the ground are reflected in the calm water. The photograph on the right is in color and depicts several modern, multi-story apartment buildings with light-colored facades and numerous balconies, also situated next to water, with their reflections visible on the surface. Above the two photographs, a horizontal, twisted, teal-colored rope is affixed to the wall, with its ends bent into short vertical lines pointing downward.
source_caption_data.final_caption: Two square photographs are presented side-by-side on a dark gray, speckled wall. The photograph on the left is in black and white, showing a cluster of old, wooden houses, including both single-story and two-story structures with pitched roofs, lining the edge of a body of water. Behind them, taller houses with pitched roofs can be seen. Most of the buildings and trees on the ground are reflected in the calm water. The photograph on the right is in color and depicts several modern, multi-story apartment buildings with light-colored facades and numerous balconies, also situated next to water, with their reflections visible on the surface. Above the two photographs, a horizontal, twisted, teal-colored rope is affixed to the wall, with its ends bent into short vertical lines pointing downward.

bad_caption: Two rectangular paintings are displayed side-by-side on a smooth, light blue wall. The painting on the left is a vibrant abstract piece featuring swirling red and yellow brushstrokes, with a large circular shape dominating the center. The painting on the right is a realistic portrait of a young woman with long black hair, wearing a green dress and sitting on a wooden chair, her hands folded in her lap. Above the two paintings, a thin, gold-colored metal rod runs horizontally, with small decorative tassels hanging from each end.
